data.enText: newspapers

data.chText: 报章杂志；报刊；印刷媒体

data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的单数名词

data.enText: newspapers and magazines

data.chText: 地方 / 全国 / 外国报刊
data.enText: the local/national/foreign press
the popular/tabloid press (= smaller newspapers with a lot of pictures and stories of famous people)

data.chText: 这件事已在报刊和电视上报道了。
data.enText: The story was reported in the press and on television.
the music/sporting press (= newspapers and magazines about music/sport)

data.chText: 与美国不同，英国报刊都是行销全国的。
data.enText: Unlike the American, the British press operates on a national scale.
the freedom of the Press/press freedom (= the freedom to report any events and express opinions)

data.chText: 这个事件一定会在各报刊广泛报道。
data.enText: The event is bound to attract wide press coverage (= it will be written about in many newspapers) .

data.chText: 记者；新闻工作者；新闻界

data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的单数名词

data.enText: the journalists and photographers who work for newspapers and magazines
The Press was/were not allowed to attend the trial.
the type or amount of reports that newspapers write about sb/sth

data.chText: 这家航空公司最近受到新闻界的责难。
data.enText: The airline has had a bad press recently (= journalists have written unpleasant things about it) .
publishing/printing
a machine for printing books, newspapers, etc.; the process of printing them

data.chText: 我们可以看到书本从印刷机上源源不断地印出。
data.enText: We were able to watch the books rolling off the presses.

data.chText: 这些价格在付印时是准确无误的。
data.enText: These prices are correct at the time of going to press .
a story that is hot off the press (= has just appeared in the newspapers)
a business that prints and publishes books
Oxford University Press
equipment for pressing
a piece of equipment that is used for creating pressure on things, to make them flat or to get liquid from them
a trouser press
a garlic press
act of pushing
an act of pushing sth with your hand or with a tool that you are holding
He gave the bell another press.
Those shirts need a press (= with an iron) .
crowd

data.chText: 拥挤的人群（或大批事物）
data.enText: a large number of people or things competing for space or movement
the press of bodies all moving the same way
cupboard
a large cupboard, usually with shelves, for holding clothes, books, etc.
push/squeeze
to push sth closely and firmly against sth; to be pushed in this way
She pressed her face against the window.
He pressed a handkerchief to his nose.
She pressed her lips together.
His body was pressing against hers.
to push or squeeze part of a device, etc. in order to make it work

data.chText: 按下按钮 / 开关；按键
data.enText: to press a button/switch/key
He pressed the lid firmly shut.
Press here to open.
She pressed down hard on the gas pedal.
to put sth in a place by pushing it firmly

data.chText: 他把一枚硬币塞进她手里，然后继续向前走。
data.enText: He pressed a coin into her hand and moved on.
to squeeze sb's hand or arm, especially as a sign of affection
to move in the direction mentioned by pushing

data.chText: 摄影记者们在王室贵宾周围挤来挤去。
data.enText: The photographers pressed around the royal visitors.

data.chText: 一大堆恼人的心事涌上他的心头。
data.enText: A host of unwelcome thoughts were pressing in on him.
try to persuade
to make strong efforts to persuade or force sb to do sth

data.chText: 如果逼问他，他就会承认对此事知情。
data.enText: If pressed , he will admit that he knew about the affair.

data.chText: 银行正在催我们偿还贷款。
data.enText: The bank is pressing us for repayment of the loan.

data.chText: 他们正催促我们尽快作出决定。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: They are pressing us to make a quick decision.
point/claim/case
to express or repeat sth with force

data.chText: 我不想老提这一点，但你确实欠我200元钱。
data.enText: I don't want to press the point , but you do owe me $200.
She is still pressing her claim for compensation.

data.chText: 他们决心把事情闹到最高层。
data.enText: They were determined to press their case at the highest level.
make flat/smooth
to make sth flat or smooth by using force or putting sth heavy on top

data.chText: 夹在书页中间压扁的花
data.enText: pressed flowers (= pressed between the pages of a book)
Press the soil flat with the back of a spade.
to make clothes smooth using a hot iron
My suit needs pressing.
fruit/vegetables
to squeeze the juice out of fruit or vegetables by using force or weight
metal
to make sth from a material, using pressure
to press a CD

data.chText: 汽车车身是用板金压制成的。
data.enText: The car bodies are pressed out of sheets of metal.
press (the) flesh

before.enText: of a famous person or politician

data.enText: to say hello to people by shaking hands
press sth home
to get as much advantage as possible from a situation by attacking or arguing in a determined way

data.chText: 把进攻 / 论证 / 论点坚持到底
data.enText: to press home an attack/an argument/a point

data.chText: 西蒙见她犹豫不决，便趁机占尽优势。
data.enText: Simon saw she was hesitating and pressed home his advantage.
press sb/sth into service
to use sb/sth for a purpose that they were not trained or intended for because there is nobody or nothing else available

data.chText: 为了营救下沉渡轮上的旅客，各类船只都被临时征用了。
data.enText: Every type of boat was pressed into service to rescue passengers from the sinking ferry.
press/push the panic button

data.chText: 惊慌失措；仓促行事；采取紧急行动
data.enText: to react in a sudden or extreme way to sth unexpected that has frightened you
press ahead/on (with sth)

data.chText: 坚决继续进行；匆忙前进；加紧
data.enText: to continue doing sth in a determined way; to hurry forward

data.chText: 这家公司正加紧推动设置新仓库的计划。
data.enText: The company is pressing ahead with its plans for a new warehouse.

data.chText: “我们今晚在这里住下好吗？”“不，咱们继续走。”
data.enText: ‘Shall we stay here for the night?’ ‘No, let's press on.’
press for sth
to keep asking for sth

data.chText: 他们不断要求修改这项法律。
data.enText: They continued to press for a change in the law.
press sth on sb

data.chText: 勉强某人接受；促某人吃（或喝）
data.enText: to try to make sb accept sth, especially food or drink, although they may not want it

data.chText: 她非要我们吃蛋糕不可。
data.enText: She kept pressing cake on us.

means: 拥挤的人群（或大批事物）

ex.chText: 他踩下油门，但是汽车没有动。
ex.enText: He pressed the gas pedal, but the car didn't move.

ex.chText: 窗子上都是灰，别把脸贴在上面！
ex.enText: Don't press your face against the dusty window!

synonyms.bx: 指某个人或物体在某一表面上施压。

ex.chText: 这种材料便于压缩，张开时速度又快。
ex.enText: This material compresses well and then expands rapidly.

ex.chText: 山坡上的积雪被压成了冰。
ex.enText: Snow falling on the mountainsides is compressed into ice.

synonyms.bx: 指外部因素使某物体积变小。

ex.chText: 即使在冬天她也不会戴帽子，她怕头发被帽子压瘪了。
ex.enText: She won't wear a hat even in winter in case her hair is squashed down by it.

ex.chText: 公交车上人很多，所以蛋糕受了些挤压。
ex.enText: There were too many people on the bus and so the cake got a bit squashed.

synonyms.bx: 指将某物压扁，常含压碎或压坏之意。

ex.chText: 没看到信号之前不要扣动扳机。
ex.enText: Don't squeeze the trigger until you see the signal.

ex.chText: 她捏捏他的手，然后离开了。
ex.enText: She squeezed his hand and left.

ex.chText: 往肉丸子上挤点橙子汁。
ex.enText: Squeeze a bit of orange juice onto the meatballs.

synonyms.bx: 指用手或手指用力捏紧某物，也指挤出液体。

ex.en: at the press of a button

data.enText: press (the) flesh

before.enText: of a famous person or politician

data.enText: to say hello to people by shaking hands
press sth home
to get as much advantage as possible from a situation by attacking or arguing in a determined way

data.chText: 把进攻 / 论证 / 论点坚持到底
data.enText: to press home an attack/an argument/a point

data.chText: 西蒙见她犹豫不决，便趁机占尽优势。
data.enText: Simon saw she was hesitating and pressed home his advantage.
press sb/sth into service
to use sb/sth for a purpose that they were not trained or intended for because there is nobody or nothing else available

data.chText: 为了营救下沉渡轮上的旅客，各类船只都被临时征用了。
data.enText: Every type of boat was pressed into service to rescue passengers from the sinking ferry.
bring/press/prefer charges against sb
to accuse sb formally of a crime so that there can be a trial in court
press/push the panic button

data.chText: 惊慌失措；仓促行事；采取紧急行动
data.enText: to react in a sudden or extreme way to sth unexpected that has frightened you
press ahead/on (with sth)

data.chText: 坚决继续进行；匆忙前进；加紧
data.enText: to continue doing sth in a determined way; to hurry forward

data.chText: 这家公司正加紧推动设置新仓库的计划。
data.enText: The company is pressing ahead with its plans for a new warehouse.

data.chText: “我们今晚在这里住下好吗？”“不，咱们继续走。”
data.enText: ‘Shall we stay here for the night?’ ‘No, let's press on.’
press for sth
to keep asking for sth

data.chText: 他们不断要求修改这项法律。
data.enText: They continued to press for a change in the law.
press sth on sb

data.chText: 勉强某人接受；促某人吃（或喝）
data.enText: to try to make sb accept sth, especially food or drink, although they may not want it

data.chText: 她非要我们吃蛋糕不可。
data.enText: She kept pressing cake on us.

tr: the act of pressing
the exertion of pressure
example: he gave the button a press
he used pressure to stop the bleeding
at the pressing of a button

tr: a weightlift in which the barbell is lifted to shoulder height and then smoothly lifted overhead
any machine that exerts pressure to form or shape or cut materials or extract liquids or compress solids
a machine used for printing
clamp to prevent wooden rackets from warping when not in use
a tall piece of furniture that provides storage space for clothes
has a door and rails or hooks for hanging clothes
the print media responsible for gathering and publishing news in the form of newspapers or magazines
a dense crowd of people
the state of demanding notice or attention
example: the insistence of their hunger
the press of business matters

tr: ask for or request earnestly
example: The prophet bid all people to become good persons

tr: force or impel in an indicated direction
example: I urged him to finish his studies

tr: lift weights
example: This guy can press 300 pounds

tr: squeeze or press together
example: she compressed her lips
the spasm contracted the muscle

tr: place between two surfaces and apply weight or pressure
example: pressed flowers

tr: press and smooth with a heated iron
example: press your shirts
she stood there ironing

tr: exert pressure or force to or upon
example: He pressed down on the boards
press your thumb on this spot

tr: make strenuous pushing movements during birth to expel the baby
example: `Now push hard,' said the doctor to the woman

tr: press from a plastic
example: press a record

tr: create by pressing
example: Press little holes into the soft clay

tr: crowd closely
example: The crowds pressed along the street

tr: exert oneself continuously, vigorously, or obtrusively to gain an end or engage in a crusade for a certain cause or person
be an advocate for
example: The liberal party pushed for reforms
She is crusading for women's rights
The Dean is pushing for his favorite candidate

tr: to be oppressive or burdensome
example: weigh heavily on the mind", "Something pressed on his mind

tr: be urgent
example: This is a pressing problem

value.def: If you press something somewhere, you push it firmly against something else.

example.ex: He pressed his back against the door...
example.tran: 他后背紧紧靠在门上。

example.ex: They pressed the silver knife into the cake.
example.tran: 他们拿银制餐刀切入蛋糕。

value.def: If you press a button or switch, you push it with your finger in order to make a machine or device work.

example.ex: Drago pressed a button and the door closed...
example.tran: 德拉戈按了一个按钮，然后门就关上了。

example.ex: There was no-one at the reception desk, so he pressed a bell for service.
example.tran: 接待处一个人也没有，于是他按了服务铃。

example.ex: ...a TV which rises from a table at the press of a button.
example.tran: 只要按下按钮就从桌子上升起的电视机

value.def: If you press something or press down on it, you push hard against it with your foot or hand.

example.ex: The engine stalled. He pressed the accelerator hard...
example.tran: 发动机熄火了。他用力踩油门。

example.ex: She stood up and leaned forward with her hands pressing down on the desk.
example.tran: 她站起来，双手撑在桌子上，身体向前倾。

value.tran: 用力按；用力挤压；用力踩

value.def: If you press for something, you try hard to persuade someone to give it to you or to agree to it.

example.ex: Police might now press for changes in the law...
example.tran: 警方现在可能竭力要求修改法律。

example.ex: They had pressed for their children to be taught French.
example.tran: 他们极力要求给他们的孩子教授法语。

value.def: If you press someone, you try hard to persuade them to do something.

example.ex: Trade unions are pressing him to stand firm...
example.tran: 各工会正在竭力劝说他坚定立场。

example.ex: Mr King seems certain to be pressed for further details...
example.tran: 看来人们一定会竭力要求金先生提供进一步的细节。

example.ex: She smiles coyly when pressed about her private life.
example.tran: 当人们追问她的私生活时，她羞涩地笑了笑。

value.def: If someone presses their claim, demand, or point, they state it in a very forceful way.

example.ex: The protest campaign has used mass strikes and demonstrations to press its demands...
example.tran: 抗议活动通过大规模罢工和示威游行来向当局提出诉求。

example.ex: His officials have visited Washington to press their case for economic aid.
example.tran: 他的官员们已经访问了华盛顿，竭力要求得到经济援助。

value.def: If an unpleasant feeling or worry presses on you, it affects you very much or you are always thinking about it.

example.ex: The weight of irrational guilt pressed on her...
example.tran: 无端的负罪感压得她喘不过气来。

example.ex: Right now, I've got other problems that are pressing on me.
example.tran: 现在又有其他一些问题困扰着我。

value.def: If you press something on someone, you give it to them and insist that they take it.

example.ex: All I had was money, which I pressed on her reluctant mother...
example.tran: 我就只有钱了，她母亲虽然不愿接受，我还是硬塞给了她。

example.ex: Food and cigarettes were pressed on him.
example.tran: 别人硬塞给他一些食品和香烟。

value.def: If you press clothes, you iron them in order to get rid of the creases.

example.ex: Vera pressed his shirt...
example.tran: 薇拉把他的衬衫熨平了。

example.ex: There's a couple of dresses to be pressed.
example.tran: 还有几件衣服要熨。

example.ex: ...clean, neatly pressed, conservative clothes.
example.tran: 干干净净、熨烫平整的式样保守的衣服

value.def: If you press fruits or vegetables, you squeeze them or crush them, usually in order to extract the juice.

example.ex: The grapes are hand-picked and pressed...
example.tran: 这些葡萄是精心挑选用来榨汁的。

example.ex: I pressed the juice of half a lemon into a glass of water.
example.tran: 我用手将半个柠檬的汁挤入一杯水中。

example.ex: ...1 clove fresh garlic, pressed or diced.
example.tran: 一瓣新鲜的大蒜，拍碎或切成丁

value.tran: 榨取，压榨，挤压（水果或蔬菜）

value.def: Newspapers are referred to as the press .

example.ex: Today the British press is full of articles on India's new prime minister...
example.tran: 今天英国的报纸上登满了关于印度新任总理的文章。

example.ex: ...freedom of the Press...
example.tran: 新闻自由

example.ex: Press reports revealed that ozone levels in the upper atmosphere fell during the past month.
example.tran: 新闻报道透露上层大气的臭氧浓度在上个月有所下降。

value.def: Journalists are referred to as the press .

example.ex: Christie looked relaxed and calm as he faced the press afterwards...
example.tran: 后来面对记者的时候，克里斯蒂显得放松而镇静。

example.ex: A meeting was promised, but the Press was not admitted.
example.tran: 承诺将召开一次会议，但是不允许记者到场。

value.def: A press or a printing press is a machine used for printing things such as books and newspapers.

example.ex: ...the invention of the printing press...
example.tran: 印刷机的发明

example.ex: He was writing the book up to the moment the presses rolled.
example.tran: 直到付梓的那一刻他才完稿。

value.def: If someone or something gets a bad press, they are criticized, especially in the newspapers, on television, or on radio. If they get a good press, they are praised.

example.ex: ...the bad press that career women consistently get in this country...
example.tran: 该国职业女性一直受到的舆论上的苛评

example.ex: Men get more bad press in her new novel.
example.tran: 在她的新小说中，男人受到了更多的谴责。

value.tran: （尤指在报纸、电视或广播上）受到批评/得到好评

value.def: If you press charges against someone, you make an official accusation against them which has to be decided in a court of law.

example.ex: I could have pressed charges against him...
example.tran: 我本可以起诉他。

example.ex: Police have announced they will not be pressing charges.
example.tran: 警方已宣布不会提起诉讼。

value.def: When a newspaper or magazine goes to press, it starts being printed.

example.ex: We check prices at the time of going to press...
example.tran: 我们会在付印的时候核对价格。

example.ex: As this column went to press, I learnt that the man had died.
example.tran: 当这个专栏开印的时候，我才知道那个人已经死了。

value.def: To press someone or something into service means to use them temporarily for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The local bar has been pressed into service as a school...
example.tran: 当地的酒吧被暂时用作学校。

example.ex: Kenny had been pressed into service to guard the door.
example.tran: 肯尼被临时雇来看门。

trans: 记者招待会；新闻发布会
水压机；液压机，（橡胶）液压打包机
美联社；美国联合通讯社；美聯社；联合通讯社；美社
压接技术；压入；事出有因
催促；迫切需要；迫切要求；催逼；敦促
